questions.question: What is meant by Python having 'batteries included'?

options.text: It requires physical batteries to run
It comes with a large set of useful modules ready to use
It charges your laptop while coding
It can only be used on mobile devices

questions.explanation: This phrase refers to the extensive standard library that comes with every Python installation.

questions.question: Which module would you use to get the command line arguments passed to your script?
questions.explanation: sys.argv is the standard way to access command line arguments.

questions.question: Which class in the 'collections' module is used to count items in a list?
questions.explanation: The Counter class is designed specifically for tallying elements in a collection.

questions.question: What is the benefit of using Standard Library modules?

options.text: They are faster than manual code

questions.explanation: Built-in modules are efficient, high-quality, and 'free' since they come with Python itself.
